etymology.description: 亦(亦) (yì, "also") + 言(言) (yán, "speech") = sound and additional meaning -> semantic of change and alteration
etymology.interpretation: The character 變(變) (biàn, "change") combines the element 亦(亦) (yì, "also") with 言(言) (yán, "speech"), suggesting a transformation or change that involves an additional aspect or condition, often of speech or expression.
etymology.simplification: The traditional form 變(變) (biàn, "change") was simplified to 变, where 言(言) (yán, "speech") is reduced to the simpler form 讠 by removing strokes.

examples.chinese: 天气变冷了(天氣變冷了)。
随着季节更替(隨著季節更替)，气候变得温和了(氣候變得溫和了)。
examples.pinyin: Suízhe jìjié gēngtì, qìhòu biàn de wēnhé le.
examples.english: As the seasons change, the climate becomes milder.

examples.chinese: 历史的车轮滚滚向前(歷史的車輪滾滾向前)，命运变了(命運變了)。
examples.pinyin: Lìshǐ de chēlún gǔngǔn xiàng qián, mìngyùn biàn le.
examples.english: The wheels of history roll on, and fate has changed.
